New Records: Virat Kohli equaled Sachin Tendulkar's ODI record with his 49th century
Key Match Events: India won the match by four wickets with 12 balls to spare
WICKET! India 269-6 (Kohli c Mother Cricket b Henry 95)
WICKET! India 128-3 (Iyer c Conway b Boult 33)
Post-Match Reflections: Rohit Sharma’s verdict: It’s a good start to the tournament. We know the job is only half done.
Tom Latham’s verdict: I thought we played reasonably well. We didn’t capitalise with the bat in the last 10 overs, but full credit to the way India bowled.
The player of the match is Mohammed Shami, who took five for 54 in his first game of the tournament.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Fireworks are seen at the end of the match after India’s win
Virat Kohli barely looks like playing a false stroke, never mind getting out
Others: Fog stopped play before, and it wiped out an entire Test match in 1998
